pageContext.claim: “What’s the difference between winning the election by two votes and winning it [Georgia] by half a million votes. I think I probably did win it by half a million....And the real truth is, I won by 400,000 votes. At least. That’s the real truth.”
pageContext.analysis: After a massive registration drive by Democrats, Georgia is evenly split between the two parties -- as shown by the Senate races the Democrats won on Jan. 5 -- so this claimed margin of victory for Trump is ridiculous. He won the state by about 200,000 votes in 2016, and the margin was only going to shrink in 2020.
